item.title: Picture-perfect Prague
item.author: Dushiyanthi Arumuganesan,
item.description: In Prague, New Year’s Eve (or Silvestr as the Czech would say) is a major celebratory holiday. With three days to experience Prague and see in 2012, my main concern was that I’d become one of the many that are inevitably frustrated by, or caught in, the tourist trap that Prague is famed for being. …

item.title: Christmas in the capital
item.author: Dushiyanthi Arumuganesan,
item.description: With just over two weeks left to go, the capital has been transformed into a beautifully illuminated, life-sized snow globe (minus the snow) in the countdown to Christmas day. So here’s your guide to enjoying the best of London’s Christmas highlights this year. As far as traditional Christmas fairs …

item.title: Terrific Tarnovan tales
item.author: Dushiyanthi Arumuganesan,
item.description: Veliko Tarnovo is one of the oldest settlements in Bulgaria, dating back at least five million years. Nicknamed ‘the Old Capital’, this timeworn city sits in a mountainous region of northern Bulgaria, surrounded by forestry and wildlife unlikely to be seen almost anywhere else in Europe. Bulgaria …

item.title: Bustling in vibrant Berlin
item.author: Dushiyanthi Arumuganesan,
item.description: Having been bitten by the travel bug severely this summer, and with just enough time and money (for once!), I wanted to book a holiday somewhere remote and unexplored. I wanted to discover the sights, sounds and smells of a foreign land for myself without feeling obligated to visit all the suggested …
